result.execSummary:
The defendant Cynthia I Pena was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 1 day granted.

miscConds.notes: Follow through with any treatment, counseling recommended by Agent. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Maintain full-time employment and/or school.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court cost waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cynthia I Pena

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Pursuant to statue, exhibits 1 and 2 from the 12/5/2014 hearing have been destroyed.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Cynthia I Pena in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1, Court conducts plea colloquy. Court finds defendant guilty. State has 24 hours to file an amended information. 

Court orders the following:
- 4 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED 1 day of credit 
- 6 months Probation. 
- Court costs WAIVED
- DNA Surcharge WAIVED
- Conditions of Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs. Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Maintain full-time employment and/or school.
Hearing on March 11, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Cynthia I Pena in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has requested video.  State will attempt to obtain video.  Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on February 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Exhibt 1-2, Pursuant to statue, Exhibits 1 and 2 are destroyed on 11/3/2015.

Defendant Cynthia I Pena in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer David G. from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Redirect by the state. State rest. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind bind over. Defense object.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 5, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Richard J. Smith in court.   Defendant Cynthia I Pena did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Christine Bohn, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant thought that the next court date was December 2, 2014.  Court addresses State's request to amend the complaint changing the case to a felony.  Court grants State's request and accepts the Amended Complaint.  Court will set this matter for pretrial.  Court trial for December 2, 2014 is canceled.  Pretrial conference scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 3:00 in CG49..
Hearing on November 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Filed by the State requesting a Court date to file an amended information and amended complaint.
Filed by the State.
Court trial on December 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cynthia I Pena in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests a trial to the court.  Court conducts colloquy with defendant on waiver of jury trial.  Court trial scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on September 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Cynthia I Pena in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Smith is new to the case and requests further proceedings date.  Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on August 28, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Cynthia I Pena in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to seek counsel.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT. 
  Hearing scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 09:30 am.
